title: We're About to LIGHT IT UP
body_text:
Michael Edwards
,
Kevin Adams
- the two most awesome, destructive army generals in the history of
EastCoastDodgeball
finally meet in the center of the Wall High School battlegrounds! May God help us all!
How It All Came About
The
"Championship Chase"
- a single-night, winner-take-all tournament set the stage for the gigantic collision scheduled for DODGEBALL CXLV. That night, "The Crazy One" outlasted teammates and opponents alike, earning one of two main event positions in the Season 15 midway showdown.
Player of the Year
'07 Adams was a preselected adversary, hand-picked by "The Writer".
So what's all the commotion about? How could this confrontation be different than all the rest? Let's take a look at the facts.
MICHAEL EDWARDS
Two-time season finale headliner (80, 100); has
never
lost a single match in his two-year career; ended the undefeated reigns of Kevin Megill and Michael Butler; participated in and won the first three-on-three war at DODGEBALL 100 as well as a rare
GodMode Rules
contest at DODGEBALL 122
Wins (5):
80
..
88
..
100
..
CX2
..
122
Victims: D. Carty, J. Tronolone, K. Fitzpatrick, K. Megill, M. Butler, R. Marzarella, R. Letsche
Losses (0)
Ties (1):
95
KEVIN ADAMS
Three-time season finale headliner (X, 50, 100); a record-setting 8 total captains victories, the most of any player in history; has not lost a match since August 2006;  competed in and won the first two-on-two captains match-up at DODGEBALL 50 as well as the first
CREAMation Rules
contest at DODGEBALL LXXXI
Wins (8):
48
..
49
..
50
..
51
..
LXXXI
..
LXXXVI
..
100
..
CX1
Victims: C. Adams, G. Cornero (2), J. Tronolone (3), K. Fitzpatrick, L. Herrera, R. Letsche (2), S. DeCuir, T. Adams
Losses: (2)
X
..
FIFTY-TWO
Ties (0)
Edwards versus K. Adams
Words alone cannot accurately describe the impatiently-awaited clash of titans on this forthcoming Independence Day '08 weekend. Best bring your "A" game ladies and gents!
Catch this never-before-witnessed "Dream Match" on July 5, beginning at 7:15pm only at Wall High School!
body_html:
Michael Edwards, Kevin Adams - the two most awesome, destructive army generals in the history of EastCoastDodgeball finally meet in the center of the Wall High School battlegrounds! May God help us all!

How It All Came About
The "Championship Chase" - a single-night, winner-take-all tournament set the stage for the gigantic collision scheduled for DODGEBALL CXLV. That night, "The Crazy One" outlasted teammates and opponents alike, earning one of two main event positions in the Season 15 midway showdown. Player of the Year '07 Adams was a preselected adversary, hand-picked by "The Writer".

So what's all the commotion about? How could this confrontation be different than all the rest? Let's take a look at the facts.


MICHAEL EDWARDS
Two-time season finale headliner (80, 100); has never lost a single match in his two-year career; ended the undefeated reigns of Kevin Megill and Michael Butler; participated in and won the first three-on-three war at DODGEBALL 100 as well as a rare GodMode Rules contest at DODGEBALL 122

Wins (5): 80 .. 88 .. 100 .. CX2 .. 122
Victims: D. Carty, J. Tronolone, K. Fitzpatrick, K. Megill, M. Butler, R. Marzarella, R. Letsche
Losses (0)
Ties (1): 95

KEVIN ADAMS
Three-time season finale headliner (X, 50, 100); a record-setting 8 total captains victories, the most of any player in history; has not lost a match since August 2006; competed in and won the first two-on-two captains match-up at DODGEBALL 50 as well as the first CREAMation Rules contest at DODGEBALL LXXXI

Wins (8): 48 .. 49 .. 50 .. 51 .. LXXXI .. LXXXVI .. 100 .. CX1
Victims: C. Adams, G. Cornero (2), J. Tronolone (3), K. Fitzpatrick, L. Herrera, R. Letsche (2), S. DeCuir, T. Adams
Losses: (2) X .. FIFTY-TWO
Ties (0)

Edwards versus K. Adams
Words alone cannot accurately describe the impatiently-awaited clash of titans on this forthcoming Independence Day '08 weekend. Best bring your "A" game ladies and gents!

Catch this never-before-witnessed "Dream Match" on July 5, beginning at 7:15pm only at Wall High School!
